security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged patterns in documentation code examples. All findings are false positives. The skill contains educational content about edge computing deployment with example code snippets in markdown. No actual command execution, credential exfiltration, or malicious behavior exists. Network access and env references are documentation references only.

content.value_statement: Building applications for edge runtimes requires special patterns for low latency and global distribution. This skill provides proven deployment patterns for Cloudflare Workers, Vercel Edge, and Deno Deploy.
actual_capabilities: Generate edge-ready middleware code for Cloudflare Workers
Create streaming response handlers for Vercel Edge runtime
Design data caching strategies for edge locations
Build edge-compatible API routes with proper error handling
limitations: Does not provision edge infrastructure or cloud resources
Does not execute or deploy code to live edge networks
Does not configure DNS, domains, or edge certificates
Does not monitor or debug running edge functions

use_cases.title: Build Low-Latency API Endpoints
use_cases.description: Create fast, globally distributed API endpoints that serve users from the nearest edge location, reducing latency for users worldwide.

use_cases.title: Implement Edge Caching Strategies
use_cases.description: Design caching layers at the edge to reduce origin server load and improve response times for static and dynamic content.

use_cases.title: Deploy Serverless Functions
use_cases.description: Convert existing functions to edge-compatible patterns that run on serverless edge runtimes without managing servers.
use_cases.target_user: Full-stack developers transitioning to edge computing

prompt_templates.title: Basic Edge Function
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Cloudflare Worker that handles incoming requests, checks a cache, and returns a response. Include proper error handling.
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a simple edge function with caching

prompt_templates.title: Edge Middleware Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Create edge middleware for Vercel that authenticates requests, adds caching headers, and handles CORS for an API route.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building middleware with authentication and caching

prompt_templates.title: Streaming Response Handler
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Deno Deploy function that streams JSON data from an upstream API, transforms it, and sends it to the client incrementally.
prompt_templates.scenario: Implementing streaming responses at the edge

prompt_templates.title: Full Edge Application
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a complete edge application structure with routing, middleware, environment configuration, and error boundaries for production deployment.

output_examples.input: Create a Cloudflare Worker that caches API responses
Write edge middleware for request authentication

best_practices: Keep edge functions small and focused to minimize cold start times and memory usage
Use streaming responses for large payloads to improve time-to-first-byte
Implement proper error handling with fallback responses for degraded functionality
anti_patterns: Avoid synchronous operations that block the edge runtime event loop
Do not store local state in edge functions since instances may be recreated
Avoid making multiple sequential upstream requests when parallelization is possible

faq.question: What edge runtimes does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill covers patterns for Cloudflare Workers, Vercel Edge Functions, and Deno Deploy. Each runtime has unique constraints and capabilities.

faq.question: How is edge computing different from traditional serverless?
faq.answer: Edge functions run closer to users in distributed data centers. They have stricter resource limits but offer lower latency by serving requests from nearby locations.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for existing serverless functions?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns help you adapt serverless code for edge constraints. You may need to refactor synchronous operations and external dependencies.

faq.question: Does this skill deploy code to edge networks?
faq.answer: No, the skill generates edge-compatible code patterns. You must deploy the code yourself using your cloud provider's tooling.

faq.question: What are the resource limits for edge runtimes?
faq.answer: Limits vary by provider. Cloudflare Workers typically allow 10-50ms CPU time and 128MB memory. Check your provider's documentation for current limits.

faq.question: How do I handle secrets and environment variables?
faq.answer: Edge runtimes support environment-specific variables through provider dashboards. Never hardcode secrets in edge function source code.
